Core Platform & Data Management.description: Provides foundational services that all monitoring features rely on, handling efficient data collection, batching, persistence, and secure upload to the Datadog platform.

Real User Monitoring (RUM).description: Collects user interactions, crashes, and application performance metrics to provide comprehensive insights into the end-user experience and application health.

This directory defines the interfaces and classes responsible for trace context propagation within the Datadog Android SDK's tracing API. This enum defines various trace propagation styles (e.g., Datadog, B3, X-Ray) used for injecting and extracting distributed tracing headers in applications. It provides methods to convert string representations to enum values and vice-versa.

This file defines the DDSpanContext class, which represents the immutable state of a Datadog Span that needs to be propagated across process boundaries and to descendant spans. It encapsulates trace identifiers, baggage, and other tracing metadata.

This file implements the core logic for injecting and extracting trace context into/from various carriers, supporting different propagation styles. It acts as a central component for distributed tracing within the Datadog Android SDK.

This file provides a no-operation (no-op) implementation of an HTTP codec for trace propagation. It includes injector and extractor constants that perform no actions, effectively disabling trace context injection or extraction.

This file defines a B3TraceId class, which extends DDTraceId to represent B3-formatted trace IDs. It stores both the parsed DDTraceId and its original string representation, delegating core ID functionalities to an internal DDTraceId instance.
This file defines the `Baggage` class, which is responsible for storing, managing, and serializing/deserializing key-value pairs for propagation across distributed traces within the Datadog SDK.
This file implements an HTTP codec for injecting and extracting tracing context information using the AWS X-Ray `X-Amzn-Trace-Id` header.

This file implements the B3 propagation codec for Datadog's Android tracing SDK. It provides functionality to inject and extract trace context (trace ID, span ID, and sampling priority) into and from HTTP headers using both single and multi-header B3 formats.

This file defines the `ExtractedContext` class, which encapsulates trace context information (trace ID, span ID, sampling priority, origin, etc.) extracted from incoming request headers. It represents the propagated data used to continue a distributed trace.

This file defines an abstract class `PropagationTags` that encapsulates logic for managing and propagating trace-related tags, such as `x-datadog-tags` and W3C tracestate, across services. It handles parsing, validation, and generation of these tags, including sampling priority and origin information.

This file defines the `TagContextExtractor` class, which is responsible for extracting tracing context information, such as trace and span IDs, from an incoming request or message carrier for distributed tracing purposes.

This file defines the HttpCodec, which is responsible for injecting and extracting distributed tracing context from HTTP headers using various propagation styles (e.g., Datadog, B3, W3C TraceContext).

This file defines a codec for injecting and extracting Datadog trace context information (trace ID, span ID, sampling priority, origin, baggage, and tags) into and from HTTP headers for trace propagation.

This file implements an HTTP codec for injecting and extracting W3C Trace Context (traceparent and tracestate headers) for distributed tracing. It handles the propagation of trace IDs, span IDs, sampling decisions, and baggage items across service boundaries via HTTP headers.

This file implements the Haystack HTTP codec for propagating trace context, including trace IDs, span IDs, and baggage, between services. It handles the conversion between Datadog's 64-bit IDs and Haystack's 128-bit UUID-like trace identifiers for HTTP headers.

This abstract class provides a framework for interpreting and extracting tracing context, client IP information, user agent, custom tags, and baggage from HTTP headers for different propagation styles. It serves as a base for specific context interpreters used in Datadog's tracing library.

This file defines the `NoOpCorePropagation` class, which implements the `AgentPropagation` interface. It provides no-operation implementations for injecting trace context, while delegating trace context extraction to an internal `HttpCodec.Extractor`.

This file implements the encoding and decoding logic for Datadog-specific propagation tags within the W3C `tracestate` header. It parses and serializes `PropagationTags` to and from W3C `tracestate` header values.
This file defines an abstract base class `TagElement` for components of propagation tags, along with an `Encoding` enum to specify different formats (e.g., Datadog or W3C) for these tag elements.

This file defines the `DatadogPTagsCodec` class, which is responsible for encoding and decoding Datadog propagation tags (`_dd.p.*` tags) from HTTP header values, including parsing, validation, and size limit enforcement.

This file defines the PTagsFactory, which is responsible for creating and managing PropagationTags instances, handling their encoding and decoding for different header types (Datadog, W3C), and managing updates to trace context elements like sampling priority and origin.

This abstract class defines the core logic and interface for encoding, decoding, and validating Datadog's propagation tags (PTags) for various serialization formats, such as HTTP headers or maps. It handles tag serialization, size limits, and specific tag validations.

This file defines the `TagValue` class, which represents a single tag value used in Datadog's trace propagation. It handles encoding differences (Datadog and W3C), provides caching for efficient reuse, and manages conversions between these formats.
This file defines the `TagKey` class, which represents and caches parts of strings (tag keys) for efficient use in propagation, often extracted from headers with different encodings.

This file defines the `PathwayContext` interface, which is used for managing and propagating context information, including checkpoints and statistics, across different services or components within a distributed system.

This file defines the `TagContext` class, which serves as a container for extracted tracing-related information, such as HTTP headers, tags, and baggage, used to enrich a span context. It specifically captures data from request headers for various security and observability features like AppSec, IAST, and CI Visibility.

This directory defines the public API for tracing functionalities within the Datadog Android SDK. It is part of the `dd-sdk-android-trace-api` feature, providing interfaces and data structures for developers to interact with the tracing system.

This file provides utility methods for working with unsigned 64-bit span IDs, including parsing them from various string formats (decimal, hexadecimal) and converting them back into string representations.
This file defines the `Stateful` interface, which represents an object that can be activated with a given context and subsequently closed. It includes a default no-op implementation for convenience.
This interface defines callbacks for managing the lifecycle of root spans in a trace, specifically for starting and finishing root spans and associating them with an EndpointTracker.
This class represents an unsigned 64-bit trace ID for Datadog, providing methods to create, parse, and convert trace IDs to decimal and hexadecimal string formats.
This interface defines a listener for tracking when a local root span, which represents an endpoint, is written. It provides a mechanism to react to the completion of an endpoint's trace.

This file defines a holder for an `EndpointCheckpointer`, allowing for a single, thread-safe registration of an actual implementation while providing a no-op default. It delegates endpoint tracking operations (like root span start/finish) to the registered checkpointer.

This file defines an abstract class, `DDTraceId`, which encapsulates trace identifiers, providing common methods for creating, parsing (from decimal or hexadecimal strings), and formatting trace IDs, supporting both 64-bit and 128-bit representations.

This file defines an abstract strategy for generating unique trace and span IDs, offering different implementations like random, sequential, and secure random generation, with support for 128-bit trace IDs.

This file defines the `DD128bTraceId` class, which encapsulates 128-bit trace identifiers, allowing for both 128-bit and 64-bit representations. It provides methods for creating, parsing, and formatting these IDs into various string representations (hexadecimal and decimal).

This interface defines a local segment of a distributed trace, allowing the addition of tags and data to either the top-level segment or the current span within that trace. It is designed for in-scope use and should not be stored or passed asynchronously.

This file defines the `MutableSpan` interface, which represents a modifiable trace span within the Datadog tracing API. It provides methods to get and set various span attributes like operation name, service, resource, tags, metrics, and error status.
Defines an interface for listening to scope activation and deactivation events within the tracing system, providing hooks for custom logic when a scope becomes active or is closed.

This file defines an interface `ExtendedScopeListener` that extends `ScopeListener`, providing additional callbacks for tracing scope activation with detailed trace and span information within the Datadog Android SDK.

This file defines the `CoreTracer` class, which serves as the main entry point for the Datadog tracing implementation. It is responsible for coordinating the creation, reporting, and propagation of traces within an application.
This class defines a `Metadata` object that encapsulates various properties and tags associated with a trace span or similar tracing context within the Datadog SDK.
Defines a functional interface for consuming metadata objects within the Datadog Android tracing SDK, extending the standard Consumer interface.

This file defines the `DDSpanLink` class, which provides helper methods for creating span link objects from extracted contexts and encoding collections of span links into a single tag value, respecting size limits.

This file defines the `CoreSpan` interface, providing the foundational contract for all Span objects within the Datadog tracing SDK. It specifies methods for accessing and manipulating common span attributes like IDs, names, timing, error status, tags, and sampling information.
This file defines the DDSpan class, which is the core representation of a tracing span in the Datadog Android SDK. It manages the lifecycle, timing, and associated metrics for individual trace spans.

This class is the primary `AgentScopeManager` implementation, responsible for managing the lifecycle of tracing scopes (AgentScope) within a ThreadLocal stack. It handles activation, continuation, and deactivation of scopes, supporting features like asynchronous propagation and scope depth limits for distributed tracing.

This class manages a stack of `ContinuableScope` objects, ensuring that the top of the stack always represents the active scope for a thread and handling cleanup of inactive or overdue scopes. It also integrates with profiling context management.

This class represents a traceable scope within the Datadog Android SDK, managing the lifecycle of an AgentSpan, its propagation across synchronous and asynchronous boundaries, and interaction with scope listeners.

This file defines `ContinuingScope`, a specialized `ContinuableScope` that manages the lifecycle of a continuation, ensuring it is cancelled when the scope is cleaned up. It represents a scope that has been continued from a previous context.

This class provides a single-use continuation mechanism for an AgentSpan within the Datadog tracing library, ensuring that a span continuation can only be activated or canceled once. It acts as a one-time token for continuing a trace, preventing issues from repeated activation.

This abstract class provides a common base for managing the continuation of an AgentSpan across asynchronous boundaries. It includes mechanisms for registering the continuation with the trace and handling cancellation when a continued scope is closed.

This class provides a thread-safe continuation mechanism for tracing spans, allowing multiple concurrent activations and closures of related scopes without prematurely closing the underlying AgentSpan.

This file defines the `TraceScope` interface, which facilitates the propagation and management of Datadog traces across threads and asynchronous operations. It provides mechanisms for capturing, activating, and canceling trace contexts to ensure complete trace reporting.
This file defines the `SpanLinkAttributes` class, which serves as a base implementation for managing and building key-value attributes associated with span links within the Datadog tracing system.
This enum defines the different sources or origins from which a tracing scope can be created, such as through instrumentation, manual API calls, or iterative processes.
This file defines byte constants for various error priority levels used within the Datadog Android SDK's tracing and instrumentation API. It establishes standard priority values for error handling.

This file defines the `SpanLink` class, which is a base implementation of `AgentSpanLink` used to represent a link between two spans, storing their trace ID, span ID, trace flags, trace state, and associated attributes.

This directory is part of the internal tracing feature within the Datadog Android SDK. It is designated for compatibility-related functional utilities or interfaces specific to the internal tracing module, ensuring consistent behavior across different environments or versions.

This directory is part of the internal tracing feature within the Datadog Android SDK. It is designated for defining and managing event-related domain models or business logic specific to the tracing functionality.

This directory is intended to house Kotlin test files for the internal tracing API of the Datadog Android SDK. It defines the testing scope for core tracing functionalities within the `com.datadog.trace.api` package.

This directory is intended to contain Kotlin utility classes for generating test data or faking objects, specifically used in testing the internal tracing features of the Datadog Android SDK. It provides support for creating necessary test fixtures for the `dd-sdk-android-trace-internal` module.

This directory defines the programmatic interfaces and data structures for the internal tracing functionality within the Datadog Android SDK. It serves as the contract for how other internal SDK components interact with its tracing mechanisms, ensuring modularity and consistent communication within the SDK's tracing feature.

This directory contains the internal Kotlin source code for implementing distributed tracing functionality specifically for the Datadog SDK's OkHttp integration. It manages the core logic required to instrument OkHttp network requests and responses, ensuring they are properly monitored and integrated into Datadog's tracing ecosystem.

This directory contains the core Kotlin source code for the tracing functionality within the Datadog Android SDK. It is responsible for implementing the features that enable performance monitoring and distributed tracing for Android applications using Datadog.

This directory contains Kotlin source code demonstrating the use of the Datadog Android SDK's tracing capabilities. It provides examples for integrating and configuring distributed tracing within the sample application, guiding developers on how to send traces effectively.

This directory is intended to contain the main source code for the tracing functionality within the 'single-fit' reliability module of the Datadog Android SDK. It serves as the primary location for the implementation of tracing features specific to this reliability component.

This directory contains Kotlin integration tests for the public API of the Datadog Android SDK's trace feature. These tests specifically target the `single-fit` reliability component, ensuring proper functionality and interaction at the API level.

This directory contains Elmyr-based data generators or property-based tests specifically for the integration tests of the Datadog Android SDK's tracing module. It supports the reliability testing efforts by providing robust and varied test data for the trace component.

This directory is dedicated to housing AssertJ-related utilities or custom assertion classes. These are specifically designed to support the integration tests for the tracing module within the Datadog Android SDK. Its role is to enhance the readability and expressiveness of test assertions for the tracing functionality.

This directory is intended to house utility functions and helper classes specifically for integration tests. These utilities would support tests evaluating the reliability of the tracing features within the Datadog Android SDK.

This directory is intended to contain integration tests for the tracing features of the Datadog Android SDK. These tests specifically target instrumented builds, ensuring proper functionality within a real application context.

This directory is intended to contain Android instrumentation integration tests for the Datadog Android SDK. Its primary role is to house tests that validate the proper functioning and integration of the SDK's tracing features within an Android application environment.

This directory is intended to house Mockito extension configuration files or resources, which might be used to customize Mockito's behavior during unit tests for the `dd-sdk-android-trace` feature. Though currently empty, it serves as a designated location for advanced Mockito test setup.

This directory is designated for JSON-related assets specific to the Datadog Android SDK's tracing feature. It would typically contain JSON schemas, configuration files, or example payloads used for trace data serialization or processing. Currently, it serves as a placeholder as no such assets are present.
This enum defines the various origins from which a configuration value can be sourced, such as environment variables, remote configuration, JVM properties, or default values.
This file defines a utility class, DDTraceApiInfo, which provides programmatic access to the current version of the Datadog trace API by reading it from a resource file.

This file defines an enum, ResolverCacheConfig, which provides named presets for configuring various cache sizes within a type resolver or matcher. These presets are designed for different application sizes and performance requirements.
Represents a single configuration setting, including its key, value, and origin. It also provides functionality to mask sensitive configuration values for security.

This file provides a utility class for parsing and validating a configuration string that specifies methods to be traced. It converts the string into a map associating class names with sets of method names, handling various format errors.

This file defines default configuration values for various features and settings within the Datadog Android SDK, such as tracing, security, debugging, and telemetry. It provides constants for common parameters like agent host, ports, error statuses, and feature enablement flags.

This interface defines a snapshot of dynamic configuration settings, such as sampling rules, data injection flags, and service mappings, that are applied to a trace for its duration within the Datadog Android SDK.

This class collects and stores configuration settings (system properties and environment variables) used by the tracer in a thread-safe manner. It allows for concurrent updates and merges of configuration values from different origins.

This file defines a mechanism for managing and dynamically updating a subset of configuration settings for the Datadog Android SDK, primarily for tracing and related features. It allows these configurations to be modified at runtime, potentially via remote configuration.

This file defines configuration settings that control how the Datadog tracer's instrumentation is applied. These settings are processed before instrumentation occurs and are often baked into native images.

This file defines the configuration parameters and their default values for the Datadog Tracer and associated features like telemetry, profiling, and crash tracking. It serves as a central point for managing various settings within the Datadog SDK for Android.
This file provides utility methods and classes to detect and query information about the Java platform, including its version and JVM runtime details, for conditional logic and compatibility checks.

This file defines constants for configuration keys used by the Datadog Java tracer (DDTracer) for various settings such as agent communication, sampling, propagation, and span attributes. These keys are used to configure the tracer via properties, system variables, or environment variables.

This file defines a collection of public static final string constants representing configuration keys for various aspects of trace instrumentation within the Datadog Java agent. These keys are used to configure tracing behavior via system properties, environment variables, or config files.

This file defines a utility class `DDTraceCoreInfo` that provides static access to core information, including Java runtime properties and the version of the `dd-trace-core` library, read from a resource file.

This file defines `PropertiesConfigSource`, a configuration source that retrieves property values from a standard Java `Properties` object, optionally converting property names to system property format for lookup.
This file provides utility methods for converting string-based configurations into various data types, such as numbers, lists, and different map formats, for the Datadog tracing library.

This file defines the `ConfigProvider` class, which is responsible for retrieving and managing configuration settings from various sources. It provides methods to fetch values of different types (strings, booleans, numbers, lists, maps, enums) and tracks their origin for observability.

This directory is intended to hold Kotlin test source files for the Datadog Android tracing SDK, specifically for components related to SQLite integration. It would contain unit or integration tests for how the tracing feature interacts with or utilizes SQLite databases.

This directory contains test data or utility classes for verifying the internal data structures and logic of the Datadog Android SDK's tracing feature. It specifically focuses on testing the internal data handling mechanisms within the `dd-sdk-android-trace` module.

This directory contains Kotlin unit tests for the internal network-related components of the Datadog Android SDK's tracing feature. Its purpose is to validate the proper functioning and integration of networking logic within the trace module.

This directory is intended to contain components for handling SQLite database operations within the Datadog Android SDK's tracing feature. It would typically store classes for persisting or querying trace data using an SQLite database. Currently, it appears to be a placeholder for such functionality.

This directory contains internal components responsible for managing the storage of tracing data within the Datadog Android SDK's tracing feature. It handles the persistence and retrieval mechanisms for trace-related information.

This directory is intended to house internal networking components for the Datadog Android Tracing SDK. It would typically contain classes responsible for handling network requests, sending trace data, and managing network communication details specific to the tracing feature.

This directory is intended to house internal data models, storage interfaces, or data handling logic specific to the implementation of the Datadog Android tracing feature. It would contain classes for managing and processing trace-related data before it's sent out or further processed.
This file defines a `ThreadFactory` implementation that creates daemon threads, primarily used for background tasks like trace processing, writing, and task scheduling within the Datadog Android SDK.

This file defines a common, single-threaded task executor for scheduling periodic tasks that automatically cancel if their target object is garbage collected. It extends `AbstractExecutorService` and includes a JVM shutdown hook.
Defines an abstract `Recording` class that provides a common interface for managing the lifecycle of a recording process, including methods to start, stop, reset, and flush recorded data.

This class tracks and manages long-running traces in the Datadog SDK, periodically flushing their updates and reporting statistics. It prevents an unbounded number of traces from being tracked by enforcing limits and handling their lifecycle.

Manages a single trace by collecting its spans, tracking their completion status, and determining when and how the trace's spans should be written to the `PendingTraceBuffer`, including special handling for long-running traces.

This file defines an abstract buffer for managing pending traces, with concrete implementations for delaying and asynchronously processing traces on a worker thread or for immediately discarding them.

This file defines the `InboxItem` interface, an internal API component for Datadog's Android SDK tracing instrumentation. It likely serves as a marker interface or a base for objects handled within the instrumentation inbox.

This file defines a `NoOpWriter` class, which is a no-operation implementation of the `Writer` interface. It serves as a placeholder that performs no actions when its methods are called, useful for testing or disabling writing functionality.
This interface defines the contract for components responsible for processing and sending collected tracing spans, including writing, starting, flushing, and closing operations.
A `Writer` implementation primarily used in tests to capture and store lists of `DDSpan` traces in memory. It provides utility methods to wait for traces to be written and can filter incoming traces.

This file implements a writer that reconstructs a trace from a list of spans, forming a tree-like structure, and outputs it in a human-readable format to a specified stream or file. It's used for debugging and visualizing trace hierarchies.

This file defines the `RemoteResponseListener` interface, which provides a contract for handling responses received after an API call to a remote service within the Datadog tracing client. It specifies a method to be invoked with the endpoint and the JSON response.

This directory contains Kotlin unit tests for the `event` domain components within the internal tracing feature (`dd-sdk-android-trace-internal`) of the Datadog Android SDK. Its primary role is to validate the logic and behavior of event-related domain models and services, ensuring the reliability of internal trace event processing.
This file provides a no-operation (no-op) implementation of the `StatsDClient` interface, serving as a placeholder when actual StatsD metric reporting is not enabled or required.

This file defines the `StatsDClient` interface, providing a contract for sending various metrics (counters, gauges, histograms, distributions) and service checks to a StatsD server. It includes methods for common StatsD operations and error handling.
This file defines an interface for a registry that provides SpanMetrics instances based on instrumentation names, conditionally enabling real metrics based on telemetry status.
This file provides the default implementation of the SpanMetrics interface, using atomic counters to track the creation and completion of spans for a specific instrumentation.

This file defines the `SpanMetrics` interface, which provides methods for tracking the creation and completion of spans for metrics purposes. It includes a no-operation (NOOP) implementation for environments where metrics are not needed.

This file provides the default implementation for a registry that manages and provides access to span metrics, organizing them by instrumentation name. It acts as a central singleton for collecting and summarizing performance data related to spans.
This file defines the `CoreCounter` interface, which describes a basic counter metric with methods to get its name, current value, and to get and reset its value.

This file defines an abstract class `HealthMetrics` that provides callback hooks for monitoring the health and lifecycle events of the Datadog trace core, specifically related to span publishing, serialization, and writer operations.

This file defines the `StatsPoint` class, a data structure used internally by the Datadog Android SDK's tracing component to represent a single statistical data point. It captures various metrics like hashes, timestamps, latencies, and payload sizes for trace segments or network edges.
This file provides a no-operation (NoOp) implementation of the MetricsAggregator interface, serving as a placeholder when metrics aggregation is disabled or not required.

This file defines the `MetricsAggregator` interface, which specifies methods for starting, reporting, and publishing trace-related metrics. It outlines the contract for aggregating and sending performance data.

This file defines a `WellKnownTags` class that encapsulates common tracing tags such as runtime ID, hostname, environment, service, version, and language, storing them as UTF-8 byte strings for efficient use.

This file defines a collection of constant string values representing different span types used within the Datadog tracing SDK, such as HTTP, database, messaging, and testing operations. It serves as a central registry for standardizing span type declarations.

This file defines constant strings used as standardized tags for various metadata within Datadog's tracing, monitoring, and profiling functionalities, especially for the Android SDK. It centralizes common keys for span attributes, error details, sampling controls, and internal system information.

This file serves as the main entry point for managing span naming decisions within Datadog's Android SDK. It selects and provides the appropriate naming schema (e.g., V0 or V1) based on a configuration parameter.

This interface defines a contract for naming policies across various types of traced operations (e.g., caches, clients, databases, messaging, servers, cloud services) within the Datadog tracing SDK, providing methods to derive operation and service names for spans.

This file defines version 0 of the naming schema for messaging operations and services within Datadog tracing. It provides specific naming conventions for inbound, outbound, and time-in-queue operations across various messaging systems like AMQP and SQS.

This file defines the version 0 naming schema for cache-related operations and services within the Datadog tracing SDK. It provides methods to generate standardized operation and service names based on the cache system being used.
This file defines the V0 naming schema for database-related traces within the Datadog Android SDK, specifying how database names, operations, and service names are derived.

This file implements version 0 of Datadog's naming schema for cloud services, primarily defining operation and service names for AWS SDK interactions and serverless functions within the tracing client.

This class implements `NamingSchema` and provides a V0 (version 0) concrete implementation for various naming strategies (e.g., cache, client, database, messaging, peer service, server, cloud) used within the Datadog tracing library.
This file defines version 0 of the client-side naming schema for Datadog traces. It provides methods to generate operation names based on communication protocols or specific client components.
Defines version 0 of the naming schema for server-side operations, specifying how operation names are constructed based on the communication protocol or the server component.

This file defines version 0 of the Peer Service Naming schema for the Datadog Android SDK tracing. It explicitly indicates that this version does not support peer service naming, acting as a disabled or placeholder implementation.

This file defines version 1 of the naming schema for messaging operations, standardizing service and operation names for various messaging systems, including cloud-specific normalization for AWS and GCP.
This file defines the Version 1 naming schema for client-side tracing operations, standardizing operation names based on the network protocol or component used.

This file defines version 1 of the naming schema for cloud-related operations and services, primarily focusing on standardizing span names for AWS SQS, SNS, and Lambda functions within the Datadog tracing system.

This file implements the NamingSchema interface for version 1, providing a centralized collection of naming conventions for various tracing components like cache, client, database, and messaging operations within the Datadog SDK for Android.
This file defines the version 1 naming conventions for server-side operations within the Datadog Android tracing SDK, providing methods to generate operation names based on protocol or component.

This file defines the version 1 naming schema for database traces, including methods to normalize database names (e.g., 'mongo' to 'mongodb') and construct operation names (e.g., 'elasticsearch.query').
This file defines the version 1 naming schema for cache operations within the Datadog Android SDK's tracing feature. It provides a standard way to name cache operations for various cache systems.

This class implements the naming schema for determining the `peer.service` tag in distributed traces for client and producer spans. It uses a hierarchical lookup, prioritizing component-specific overrides and predefined tag precursors, to assign a meaningful service name to the peer.

This file provides utilities for normalizing and constructing HTTP resource names for both server and client spans within the Datadog trace library. It applies configured normalization rules and priorities to generate appropriate resource names based on HTTP method and path.
This file implements an HTTP path normalizer using Ant-style patterns to map request paths to standardized resource names, utilizing a cache for performance.
Defines an abstract base class for normalizing HTTP paths. It provides a contract for implementing path normalization logic, potentially handling encoded paths.
Provides a simple implementation for normalizing HTTP paths by anonymizing numeric segments with '?' (excluding version identifiers like 'v1') and handling whitespace according to configuration.

This file provides a utility class, `SQLNormalizer`, that processes SQL strings to remove numeric values and common SQL literals (e.g., quoted strings, hex literals) by replacing them with a '?' placeholder. Its purpose is to reduce sensitive information in SQL queries for tracing, producing a UTF-8 encoded byte string.

This file defines an interface for post-processing tags, allowing for modification or transformation of tag maps before they are used. It provides methods to process tags, optionally taking a DDSpanContext into account for context-aware processing.

This class implements a `TagsPostProcessor` to add a `base service` tag to a span's tags if its current service name differs from a pre-configured base service name, ensuring the original service context is preserved.

This file defines a `PostProcessorChain` class, which acts as a composite tag post-processor. It applies a sequence of `TagsPostProcessor` instances to a map of tags, with the output of one processor becoming the input for the next.
This class calculates, sets, and remaps the 'peer.service' tag on spans, applying default naming schemes or user-defined mappings to standardize service names.

This file provides a factory for creating and managing a singleton instance of `TagsPostProcessor`, which applies a chain of transformations to Datadog trace tags. It dynamically configures this processing chain, primarily for testing purposes.

This file defines a `QueryObfuscator` class responsible for redacting sensitive information within HTTP query parameters and URLs. It uses a configurable regular expression to identify and replace secret values with a placeholder like "<redacted>" in `http.query` and `http.url` tags.

This file defines the `TagInterceptor` class, which is responsible for intercepting and processing specific tags on a Datadog span. It applies various rules and transformations, such as setting resource names, handling service names, and managing sampling decisions, to enrich tracing data.
This file provides utility methods for handling DataDog tags, including sanitizing tags according to DataDog's guidelines and concatenating multiple tags into a single string.

This class wraps a Java String and caches its UTF-8 byte representation, implementing CharSequence to allow interoperation with regular String instances while optimizing for repeated UTF-8 encoding needs.

This file defines common constants for OpenTracing-compatible span tag names and span kind values used within the Datadog Android SDK, including standard HTTP, database, peer, CI/CD, Git, runtime, and testing-related tags.

This file defines a collection of constant tag and metric keys used across various instrumentation modules. Its primary purpose is to facilitate efficient handling and encoding of these commonly used keys within the tracing system.

This file provides utility methods for decoding percent-encoded strings and safely parsing URIs, including a `LazyUrl` class for deferred URL evaluation. It ensures robust handling of invalid URI sequences and malformed inputs.

This file defines constant byte values representing the priority levels for different methods of setting or inferring resource names within Datadog's tracing instrumentation. It establishes an order for how resource names are determined and overridden.

This directory is part of the Datadog Android SDK's sample application, specifically for benchmarking. It is designated to contain Java source code related to tracing user interface components within the benchmark sample. Its purpose is to house performance-related code for UI tracing.
This file defines the `EventType` class, which serves as a unique identifier for various events within the system, potentially associating them with a specific callback type.

Defines an interface for a request-scoped context object used by the instrumentation gateway, carrying trace data and providing mechanisms for handling blocked responses. It includes a no-operation implementation for default behavior.

This file defines an interface for committing a blocking response within the Datadog tracing context. It provides a method to attempt blocking a request, including setting the status code, content type, and additional headers.
This file defines the `RequestContextSlot` enum, which identifies different contextual slots within a request, used by various tracing and security features like AppSec, CI Visibility, and IAST.

This interface defines methods for accessing and modifying information about a Datadog span, including its trace ID, span ID, tags, and request blocking actions, primarily used within the API gateway.

This file defines the `Flow` interface and related classes, representing the outcome of an event processed by a callback, which can include an action (blocking or non-blocking) and an optional result.

This file defines a class that holds global flags indicating the active status of various internal subsystems within the Datadog Android SDK. Specifically, it includes a flag to track whether the Application Security (AppSec) subsystem is active.
This file defines an enum, `BlockingContentType`, used within the Datadog SDK to specify the content type of blocking responses for application security, such as HTML or JSON.

This file defines constants representing various priority sampling decisions for distributed traces. These values indicate whether a trace should be kept, dropped, or is unset, based on sampler or user choices.

This file defines the `SamplingRule` interface, outlining the criteria for how traces or spans should be sampled based on attributes like service, name, resource, and tags, along with nested interfaces for trace-specific and span-specific sampling rules.
This class provides a utility to match a set of key-value tags, supporting exact string matching and glob pattern matching, against the tags present in a `CoreSpan` object.

This file defines constant string values, `KEEP` and `DROP`, used internally within the Datadog tracing SDK to represent decisions for trace sampling, indicating whether a trace should be kept or discarded.
Defines an interface for setting the sampling priority of a span, intended for use within the Datadog Android SDK's tracing internals.
This file defines `AllSampler`, a sampling strategy that always allows traces to be sampled, effectively disabling sampling and ensuring all traces are kept.

This file defines the `RateSampler` interface, which extends `Sampler` and provides a method to retrieve the sampling rate. It is part of the common sampling utilities within the Datadog Android SDK's tracing module.

This file defines constants for various trace priority sampling decisions, indicating whether a trace should be kept or dropped by the sampler or user. It is deprecated and has been replaced by `com.datadog.trace.api.sampling.PrioritySampling`.

This file defines the `Sampler` interface for determining whether a trace should be reported, along with a `Builder` class that constructs various sampler implementations based on configuration settings.
This file defines a sampler that always allows a span to be sampled, but its main purpose is to explicitly force a predefined sampling priority and mechanism onto the span.
This file defines an interface and implementation for sampling individual spans based on configured rules, including rate limiting, to control which spans are traced.
This file implements a distributed trace sampler that dynamically adjusts sampling rates for traces based on their service name and environment, receiving rate updates from a remote agent.

This file defines an abstract class for deterministic sampling in tracing, allowing traces or spans to be sampled based on their IDs and a configured rate using an algorithm consistent with the Datadog Agent.

This file defines the `TraceSamplingRules` class, which is responsible for deserializing and managing a collection of trace sampling rules from a JSON string. It includes nested classes for representing individual rules and their JSON-friendly counterparts, used to configure how traces are sampled based on criteria like service, name, and resource.

This file defines classes and methods for deserializing and managing span sampling rules from JSON, enabling dynamic configuration of tracing behavior based on service, name, resource, tags, sample rate, and rate limits.

This file implements a trace sampler that applies a set of configurable rules (based on service, operation, or trace attributes) to determine whether a trace should be sampled. It also incorporates a global rate limiter and a fallback sampler for traces that don't match any specific rule.

This file defines an abstract `SamplingRule` class and several concrete implementations that specify conditions for sampling trace spans in the Datadog Android SDK. These rules allow matching spans based on attributes like service name, operation, resource, or tags, and integrate with rate-based samplers or limiters.

This directory contains unit tests written in Kotlin for the common sampling logic within the internal tracing feature of the Datadog Android SDK. It specifically validates the behavior and correctness of the sampling algorithms used internally for trace collection.
This file implements a logger for Datadog's core tracing components, adapting a generic Logger interface to Datadog's internal logging mechanism for various log levels and message formats.
Provides a no-operation (null object) implementation of the Logger interface, effectively discarding all log messages and reporting that all logging levels are disabled.
This file defines the `Logger` interface, providing a standard API for logging messages at different severity levels (debug, info, warn, error) within the Datadog Android SDK.

This interface defines a contract for creating logger instances within the Datadog Android SDK's internal tracing module. It provides methods to obtain `Logger` objects, potentially integrating with an internal logging mechanism.

This file defines a `LoggerFactory` class responsible for creating and providing `Logger` instances for the Datadog tracing module. It offers different logger implementations, including a no-operation logger and a `DatadogCoreTracerLogger`.
This file defines a `RatelimitedLogger` class that logs messages only once per a specified delay, unless debugging is enabled, in which case it logs every time.

This directory contains Kotlin unit tests for the internal logging components of the Datadog Android tracing SDK. It is responsible for ensuring the correct functionality and integration of logging within the tracing feature.

Framework & Library Integrations.description: Provides automatic instrumentation for popular Android libraries and frameworks (e.g., OkHttp, Glide, Jetpack Compose, SQLDelight), simplifying data collection for RUM, APM, and other monitoring products.

files.description: This class adapts OpenTelemetry SpanContext and its attributes into the DatadogSpanLink interface, making OpenTelemetry trace link information compatible with Datadog's tracing system.

This file defines an adapter class, OtelSpanContext, which bridges Datadog's internal DatadogSpanContext with the OpenTelemetry SpanContext interface. It allows Datadog trace contexts to be exposed and consumed through OpenTelemetry APIs.
This README provides an overview of the Datadog SDK OpenTelemetry extensions for OkHttp, detailing how to track network requests and add parent spans using the `OkHttp` library.

This directory is intended to house Mockito extension files or configuration resources specifically for the test suite of the `dd-sdk-android-okhttp-otel` integration module. Although currently empty, its purpose would be to customize or extend Mockito's behavior during testing.

This directory is designated for Kotlin test files within the `dd-sdk-android-okhttp-otel` integration module. It specifically contains tests to ensure the proper functioning of the Datadog Android SDK's integration with OkHttp, particularly when OpenTelemetry features are active.

This directory contains the main Kotlin source code for the Datadog Android SDK's integration with OkHttp and OpenTelemetry. It holds the core classes and logic responsible for bridging OkHttp network requests with OpenTelemetry tracing and reporting them to Datadog.
